titleStmt.title: A song in praise of the leather bottel. Shewing how glasses and pots are laid aside, and flaggons and noggins they cannot abide; and let all wives do what they can, ... for the praise and use of man; and this you may very well be sure, the leather bottel will longest endures and I wish in heaven his soul may dwell, that first devised the leather bottel. To the tune of, The bottel-maker's delight, &c.
titleStmt.author: Wade, John, fl. 1660-1680.
